trans-unit.source: How to create and deploy a cloud service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to create and deploy a cloud service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create and deploy a cloud service using the Quick Create method in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create and deploy a cloud service using the Quick Create method in Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to create and deploy a cloud service
trans-unit.target: How to create and deploy a cloud service

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal provides two ways for you to create and deploy a cloud service: Quick Create and Custom Create.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal provides two ways for you to create and deploy a cloud service: Quick Create and Custom Create.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use the Quick Create method to create a new cloud service and then use Upload to upload and deploy a cloud service package in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use the Quick Create method to create a new cloud service and then use Upload to upload and deploy a cloud service package in Azure.

trans-unit.source: When you use this method, the Azure portal makes available convenient links for completing all requirements as you go.
trans-unit.target: When you use this method, the Azure portal makes available convenient links for completing all requirements as you go.

trans-unit.source: If you're ready to deploy your cloud service when you create it, you can do both at the same time using Custom Create.
trans-unit.target: If you're ready to deploy your cloud service when you create it, you can do both at the same time using Custom Create.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to publish your cloud service from Visual Studio Online (VSO), use Quick Create, and then set up VSO publishing from the Azure Quickstart or the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to publish your cloud service from Visual Studio Online (VSO), use Quick Create, and then set up VSO publishing from the Azure Quickstart or the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Continuous Delivery to Azure by Using Visual Studio Online[tfstutorialforcloudservice], or see help for the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Continuous Delivery to Azure by Using Visual Studio Online[tfstutorialforcloudservice], or see help for the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: Three components are required to deploy an application as a cloud service in Azure:
trans-unit.target: Three components are required to deploy an application as a cloud service in Azure:

trans-unit.source: Service Definition
trans-unit.target: Service Definition

trans-unit.source: The cloud service definition file (.csdef) defines the service model, including the number of roles.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service definition file (.csdef) defines the service model, including the number of roles.

trans-unit.source: Service Configuration
trans-unit.target: Service Configuration

trans-unit.source: The cloud service configuration file (.cscfg) provides configuration settings for the cloud service and individual roles, including the number of role instances.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service configuration file (.cscfg) provides configuration settings for the cloud service and individual roles, including the number of role instances.

trans-unit.source: Service Package
trans-unit.target: Service Package

trans-unit.source: The service package (.cspkg) contains the application code and configurations and the service definition file.
trans-unit.target: The service package (.cspkg) contains the application code and configurations and the service definition file.

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about these and how to create a package <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about these and how to create a package <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prepare your app
trans-unit.target: Prepare your app

trans-unit.source: Before you can deploy a cloud service, you must create the cloud service package (.cspkg) from your application code and a cloud service configuration file (.cscfg).
trans-unit.target: Before you can deploy a cloud service, you must create the cloud service package (.cspkg) from your application code and a cloud service configuration file (.cscfg).

trans-unit.source: The Azure SDK provides tools for preparing these required deployment files.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SDK provides tools for preparing these required deployment files.

trans-unit.source: You can install the SDK from the <link><linkText>Azure Downloads</linkText><title></title></link> page, in the language in which you prefer to develop your application code.
trans-unit.target: You can install the SDK from the <link><linkText>Azure Downloads</linkText><title></title></link> page, in the language in which you prefer to develop your application code.

trans-unit.source: Three cloud service features require special configurations before you export a service package:
trans-unit.target: Three cloud service features require special configurations before you export a service package:

trans-unit.source: If you want to deploy a cloud service that uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for data encryption, configure your application for SSL.
trans-unit.target: If you want to deploy a cloud service that uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for data encryption, configure your application for SSL.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Configure an SSL Certificate on an HTTPS Endpoint</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to Configure an SSL Certificate on an HTTPS Endpoint</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure Remote Desktop connections to role instances, configure the roles for Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure Remote Desktop connections to role instances, configure the roles for Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: For more information about preparing the service definition file for remote access, see <link><linkText>Set Up a Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about preparing the service definition file for remote access, see <link><linkText>Set Up a Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure verbose monitoring for your cloud service, enable Azure Diagnostics for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure verbose monitoring for your cloud service, enable Azure Diagnostics for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Minimal monitoring (the default monitoring level) uses performance counters gathered from the host operating systems for role instances (virtual machines).
trans-unit.target: Minimal monitoring (the default monitoring level) uses performance counters gathered from the host operating systems for role instances (virtual machines).

trans-unit.source: Verbose monitoring gathers additional metrics based on performance data within the role instances to enable closer analysis of issues that occur during application processing.
trans-unit.target: Verbose monitoring gathers additional metrics based on performance data within the role instances to enable closer analysis of issues that occur during application processing.

trans-unit.source: To find out how to enable Azure Diagnostics, see <link><linkText>Enabling diagnostics in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To find out how to enable Azure Diagnostics, see <link><linkText>Enabling diagnostics in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To create a cloud service with deployments of web roles or worker roles, you must create the service package.
trans-unit.target: To create a cloud service with deployments of web roles or worker roles, you must create the service package.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the files related to the package, see <link><linkText>Set Up a Cloud Service for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the files related to the package, see <link><linkText>Set Up a Cloud Service for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To create the package file, see <link><linkText>Package an Azure Application</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To create the package file, see <link><linkText>Package an Azure Application</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Visual Studio to develop your application, see <link><linkText>Publishing a Cloud Service using the Azure Tools</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Visual Studio to develop your application, see <link><linkText>Publishing a Cloud Service using the Azure Tools</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: If you haven't installed the Azure SDK, click Install Azure SDK to open the Azure Downloads page, and then download the SDK for the language in which you prefer to develop your code.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't installed the Azure SDK, click Install Azure SDK to open the Azure Downloads page, and then download the SDK for the language in which you prefer to develop your code.

trans-unit.source: (You'll have an opportunity to do this later.)
trans-unit.target: (You'll have an opportunity to do this later.)

trans-unit.source: If any role instances require a certificate, create the certificates.
trans-unit.target: If any role instances require a certificate, create the certificates.

trans-unit.source: Cloud services require a .pfx file with a private key.
trans-unit.target: Cloud services require a .pfx file with a private key.

trans-unit.source: You can upload the certificates to Azure as you create and deploy the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You can upload the certificates to Azure as you create and deploy the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For information about certificates, see <link><linkText>Manage Certificates</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about certificates, see <link><linkText>Manage Certificates</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to deploy the cloud service to an affinity group, create the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to deploy the cloud service to an affinity group, create the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: You can use an affinity group to deploy your cloud service and other Azure services to the same location in a region.
trans-unit.target: You can use an affinity group to deploy your cloud service and other Azure services to the same location in a region.

trans-unit.source: You can create the affinity group in the Networks area of the Azure portal, on the Affinity Groups page.
trans-unit.target: You can create the affinity group in the Networks area of the Azure portal, on the Affinity Groups page.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Create an Affinity Group in the Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Create an Affinity Group in the Management Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create a cloud service and upload the deployment package
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create a cloud service and upload the deployment package

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click New > Compute, and then scroll down to and click Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: Click New > Compute, and then scroll down to and click Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish your cloud service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish your cloud service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the new Cloud Service blade, enter a value for the DNS name.
trans-unit.target: In the new Cloud Service blade, enter a value for the DNS name.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Resource Group or select an existing one.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Resource Group or select an existing one.

trans-unit.source: Select a Location.
trans-unit.target: Select a Location.

trans-unit.source: Select Package, and on the Upload a package blade, fill in the required fields.
trans-unit.target: Select Package, and on the Upload a package blade, fill in the required fields.

trans-unit.source: If any of your roles contain a single instance, ensure Deploy even if one or more roles contain a single instance is selected.
trans-unit.target: If any of your roles contain a single instance, ensure Deploy even if one or more roles contain a single instance is selected.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that Start deployment is selected.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that Start deployment is selected.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish your cloud service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish your cloud service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Upload a certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload a certificate

trans-unit.source: If your deployment package was <link><linkText>configured to use certificates</linkText><title></title></link>, you can upload the certificate now.
trans-unit.target: If your deployment package was <link><linkText>configured to use certificates</linkText><title></title></link>, you can upload the certificate now.

trans-unit.source: Select Certificates, and on the Add certificates blade, select the SSL certificate .pfx file, and then provide the Password for the certificate,
trans-unit.target: Select Certificates, and on the Add certificates blade, select the SSL certificate .pfx file, and then provide the Password for the certificate,

trans-unit.source: Click Attach certificate, and then click OK on the Add certificates blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Attach certificate, and then click OK on the Add certificates blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Create on the Cloud Service blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Create on the Cloud Service blade.

trans-unit.source: When the deployment has reached the Ready status, you can proceed to the next steps.
trans-unit.target: When the deployment has reached the Ready status, you can proceed to the next steps.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish your cloud service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish your cloud service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Verify your deployment completed successfully
trans-unit.target: Verify your deployment completed successfully

trans-unit.source: Click the cloud service instance.
trans-unit.target: Click the cloud service instance.

trans-unit.source: The status should show that the service is Running.
trans-unit.target: The status should show that the service is Running.

trans-unit.source: Under Essentials, click the Site URL to open your cloud service in a web browser.
trans-unit.target: Under Essentials, click the Site URL to open your cloud service in a web browser.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>CloudServices_QuickGlance</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>CloudServices_QuickGlance</linkText>
